Please refer to the CEN website: www.cen-neurologie.fr where videos are available.

question.title: What is the primary function of the facial nerve?
question.description: The facial nerve is responsible for controlling the muscles of facial expression. What is its primary function?

option_a.title: Regulating body temperature
option_a.description: The facial nerve helps to regulate body temperature through sweat glands

option_b.title: Controlling facial expressions
option_b.description: The facial nerve controls the muscles of facial expression

option_c.title: Transferring sensory information
option_c.description: The facial nerve carries sensory information from the face to the brain

option_d.title: Stimulating salivation
option_d.description: The facial nerve stimulates salivation in the mouth
